exercises.title: digital_root
exercises.description: Write a method, `digital_root(num)`. It should sum the digits of a positive integer. If it is greater than or equal to 10, sum the digits of the resulting number. Keep repeating until there is only one digit in the result, called the 'digital root'. Do not use string conversion within your method.

exercises.title: caesar_cipher
exercises.description: Write a function that takes a message and an increment amount and outputs the same letters shifted by that amount in the alphabet. Assume lowercase and no punctuation. Preserve spaces.

exercises.title: common_substrings
exercises.description: Write a function, `common_substrings(str1, str2)` that takes two strings and returns the longest common substring.

exercises.title: sum_rec
exercises.description: Write a function that takes an array of integers and returns their sum. Use recursion.

exercises.title: fibs
exercises.description: Write a function, `fibs(num)` which returns the first n elements from the fibonnacci sequence, given n.

exercises.title: isPalindrome
exercises.description: Write a JavaScript function that takes a string and returns true if it's a palindrome, false if it's not. Use Javascript. This solution takes less time and memory than rebuilding the string backward and comparing the two.

exercises.title: valid_ip?
exercises.description: Write a method that takes a string as input. It should return true if the input is a valid IPv4 address (ie. anything between `0.0.0.0` and `255.255.255.255` is valid).

exercises.title: sum_from_file
exercises.description: Write a method that reads in a file of integers, one per line, and sums them. Skip the line if it begins with a '#'.
